34#ifndef OPENPAM_CTYPE_H_INCLUDED
35#define OPENPAM_CTYPE_H_INCLUDED
36
37/*
38 * Evaluates to non-zero if the argument is a digit.
39 */
40#define is_digit(ch) \
41 (ch >= '0' && ch <= '9')
42
43/*
44 * Evaluates to non-zero if the argument is a hex digit.
45 */
46#define is_xdigit(ch) \
47 ((ch >= '0' && ch <= '9') || \
48 (ch >= 'a' && ch <= 'f') || \
49 (ch >= 'A' && ch <= 'F'))
50
51/*
52 * Evaluates to non-zero if the argument is an uppercase letter.
53 */
54#define is_upper(ch) \
55 (ch >= 'A' && ch <= 'Z')
56
57/*
58 * Evaluates to non-zero if the argument is a lowercase letter.
59 */
60#define is_lower(ch) \
61 (ch >= 'a' && ch <= 'z')
62
63/*
64 * Evaluates to non-zero if the argument is a letter.
65 */
66#define is_letter(ch) \
67 (is_upper(ch) || is_lower(ch))
68
69/*
70 * Evaluates to non-zero if the argument is a linear whitespace character.
71 * For the purposes of this macro, the definition of linear whitespace is
72 * extended to include the form feed and carraige return characters.
73 */
74#define is_lws(ch) \
75 (ch == ' ' || ch == '\t' || ch == '\f' || ch == '\r')
76
77/*
78 * Evaluates to non-zero if the argument is a whitespace character.
79 */
80#define is_ws(ch) \
81 (is_lws(ch) || ch == '\n')
82
83/*
84 * Evaluates to non-zero if the argument is a printable ASCII character.
85 * Assumes that the execution character set is a superset of ASCII.
86 */
87#define is_p(ch) \
88 (ch >= '!' && ch <= '~')
89
90/*
91 * Returns non-zero if the argument belongs to the POSIX Portable Filename
92 * Character Set. Assumes that the execution character set is a superset
93 * of ASCII.
94 */
95#define is_pfcs(ch) \
96 (is_digit(ch) || is_letter(ch) || \
97 ch == '.' || ch == '_' || ch == '-')
98
99#endif
100
